quote: As a classic ill-posed problem, estimating accurate depth from a single image is challenging.
Encoder plays a crucial role in extracting features from input images for depth estimation.
We propose the more effective crop strategy R 2 crop, in which we randomly select the size of crop patches and the cropped locations.
Our solution achieves 0.311 si-RMSE with 37ms on the Raspberry Pi 4.
However, the predicted depth maps are very rough around the edges due to the excessive down-sampling.
Encoder selection is crucial to the trade-off between fidelity and runtime.
the teacher model provides more reasonable and sharper depth estimation results.
more effective distillation strategies should be designed for monocular depth estimation.
we propose to adopt structure-aware distillation.
Depthformer: Exploiting long-range correlation and local information for accurate monocular depth estimation.
Transformers solve the limited receptive field for monocular depth prediction.
Enforcing geometric constraints of virtual normal for depth prediction.
